hypothesis_content.title: Holiday Weekend Reversal Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, a sharp intraday price move (>2.5%) on the Friday before a major US holiday (e.g., Christmas, July 4th) will reverse direction by the following Tuesday's market open, as low liquidity exaggerates moves that are not sustained by institutional flows.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Holiday thinned liquidity leads to exaggerated, often unsustainable, price moves driven by retail or automated systems. Institutional rebalancing and return of normal liquidity post-holiday frequently correct these moves. The hypothesis exploits this timing mismatch.
entry_conditions: BTC experiences a >2.5% intraday move (up or down) on a Friday preceding a major US market holiday
The move occurs during a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >55%)
Aggregated daily spot volume is <80% of its 20-day average
Entry: Market order at the Tuesday 00:00 UTC open following the holiday weekend

exit_conditions.stop_loss: 1.2% loss from entry price (fading the initial move)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If the initial Friday move continues in the same direction through the following Tuesday open >60% of the time, or if the mean reversion profit target is not hit within 48 hours in >55% of instances.
